evidence: Refractory high-entropy alloy Mo 0.5 NbHf 0.5 ZrTi is selected as the base alloy and element Si is added for preparing the (Mo 0.5 NbHf 0.5 ZrTi) BCC /M 5 Si 3 in-situ compound. The effect of Si on the microstructure and mechanical properties of Mo 0.5 NbHf 0.5 ZrTi alloy is analyzed and discussed.
Without the addition of Si, the hardness is 398 HV
the hardness reaches to 638 HV when the content of Si is 0.9.
The results of this work demonstrate that the addition of Si to Mo 0.5 NbHf 0.5 ZrTi alloy have very beneficial effects. The hardness and yield strength increase with the addition of Si.
